comments.content:
Alice sent me this recently and I told her I didn't recognize it, and thought it might be engraving or film type used by a stationer. It's the main thing they can offer that we can't all reproduce by buying the font.   
(This was the image she sent me)   
 ![AlicesSample](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141930im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23630.jpg)

Mike, if you don't recognize it, I'm not sure any of us has any hope in doing so!   
   
I'd check the wedding-invitation catalogue that was sent to me in the mail -- now that I'm caught up in the wheels of the bridal industry -- but I threw it out in disgust. I'll be designing ours, thankyouverymuch -- now if I could only find the right typeface...

Looking at it again, and checking some other books, I think it looks a fair amount like Zoom Script (Solotype). Jason Walcott did this one for Jukebox as "Opulence". The sample is from my Script guide. You can get it from Veer.com   
 ![Opulence/ZoomScript](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516141930im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/23636.gif)

Whoops, wrong 'r' and wrong 'S'. If it's one of the similar Z-series Solotype Scripts, it means it's probably only got a small chance of being digitized. I guess I really didn't know what it was.   
   
Sorry. Still I think this is quite close.
